newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israeli March diamond exports unchanged on year.
newsitem.headline: Israeli March diamond exports unchanged on year.

text.p: Israel's net exports of polished diamonds reached $332 million in March, virtually unchanged from $331 million a year earlier, the Industry and Trade Ministry said on Tuesday.
In the first quarter, diamond exports were up 9.0 percent from a year earlier to $1.38 billion, the ministry said.
Exports on partially worked diamonds rose 15 percent in March to $75 million, it added.

Tsvi Anbar, the head of the diamond unit at the ministry, said representatives of the Israeli industry would be seeking improved terms for its diamond allotments in discussions this week with the Central Selling Organisation (CSO), or Syndicate.
Anbar said Israel wanted a bigger allotment of uncut diamonds from the CSO and higher quality stones.
He said the CSO, which accounts for 75 percent of all world trade in uncut diamonds, supplied 30 percent of Israel's uncut diamond imports last year, or $1.1 billion.
